I have wanted a drone for 2 yrs.  When I found the mini I quickly looked online and found a great used one and took the plunge.  Because of our weather I only have 3 partial batteries through it and 2 full batteries but so far, it’s amazing.  Flown in -20 celcius and strong wind with easy and new pilot ease.  The day I got to fly at -0 cel. was awesome.  Can’t wait for spring.  My advice.  Before your first flight. Everyone will tell you to Update controller and drone firmware.  Also do all calibration tests. What some ppl forget and I did and it caused me a ton of unnecessary grief was to update my phone firmware.  Amazing drone.!!!

Another useful tip I found. It seems there are inexperienced and experienced ppl that loose there drones. This often results in them having spare batteries, controller and charger. Put wanted ads on kijiji or Craigslist and you can get spare equipment for reasonable. Here in Canada the drone is $650(fly more) and I got mine for $450 slightly used. I put up a wanted ad and also got 2 more batteries a spare case, extra controller and charger for $200.
Unlimited fly time now. You do have to bind the controller any time you switch controllers but this is easy.

Hi Louis, Great video, thanks. The part where you rank the various drones by feature really helpful.


However, sorry to put the dampers on this but, you can't fly drones outside the regulations (approx. 8m53s), even if the drone is outside the registration criteria 😌....well, not in the UK anyway.



Here's an extract from Civil Aviation Authority's site:
“You do not need to pass the test or register if your drone or model aircraft is less than 250g, or you’ll only fly indoors or in a securely netted area. You must still follow the rules and regulations when you fly.”



See https://register-drones.caa.co.uk and https://register-drones.caa.co.uk/drone-code

The thing that stood out to me most in the image comparisons was how the Spark image looks the best straight out of the camera. The Mini is way too bright. Dropping the EV may have helped, but with no manual ISO and WB, it's not ideal. Obviously, you'd be able to get better post-grade stuff with the Air and the Pro 2, but it has to be said, that straight out of the camera, the Spark is damn good.

Good review but I'm curious why people do reviews in 30p when everyone in the industry uses 24p? Why not do all tests in 24p? Does the new Mavic Air Mini not shoot in 24p?

@SquiDragon it's 'p' for progressive (vs. i for interlaced). It's how the sensor is scanned and almost nothing these days is interlaced (where it takes 2 full sensor scans to get a full frame). almost like no one uses NTSC vs. PAL anymore in new gear.
@SquiDragon yes it's a short term for fps but in the US, professional video is shot mostly in 24p setting in the camera. It's also a standard for cinematic shooting.

In germany sub 250g means:
- no "numberplate" - over 250g there has to be a fireproof sticker.
- still insurance needed BUT drone insurance is already included in a lot householdinsurances - over 250g there are special drone tariffs. (80$ p.A.)

James Moxley that’s exactly right. In Canada, with a basic operations license, you cannot fly a drone over 250g:
- within 30 meters laterally in any direction from other people
- over or near any advertised event
- for at least 24h after consuming any alcohol
- without registration
- etc etc

Having a drone under 250g changes all that. The only rule to follow in Canada for a 249g drone is not to endanger or likely endanger people (i.e. fly responsibly).

Based on that alone, the Mavic Mini is the absolute best drone for Canada!

Cherry on top: it sells for $50 USD cheaper for Canada ($349 USD for the drone or $449 USD for fly more combo) 🇨🇦
@AndyRC No Andy, we have different rules here in Canada, and a lot of other countries, it's not just about registration, is actually about having a license/certificate to fly.
@James M thats what I said?
In Canada you have to have a license to fly over 250g unless you are flying at a MAAC field, and also the rules of where you can fly are relaxed for sub 250g
